basis: The user repeatedly confirms testing tonight with exact defaults and an on-device, privacy-focused setup. They explicitly state readiness to test day one, allow skipping the check-in, and want an auto-fill script. This strongly indicates they will implement and perform the plan.
cognitive_dissonance: Low. The plan aligns with their BED goals and privacy needs; minor tension about feasibility on busy nights is mitigated by flexible check-in and optional prompts.
negative_thought_patterns: Possible perfectionism about adhering exactly to prompts/logs; occasional avoidance of logging when rushed; risk of cognitive load if too many steps.
emotional_triggers: Privacy concerns, sense of control, desire for simplicity, motivation to manage BED symptoms.
coaching_notes: Keep templates lean; emphasize optional prompts and check-in; offer a one-click or single-tap log; ensure backups remain optional; celebrate adherence and adjust based on day-one feedback.
